events.title: Repeal of the Stamp Act
events.description: The British Parliament repealed the Stamp Act, a tax imposed on the American colonies that had caused widespread protest.
events.significance: Marked a significant moment in colonial resistance and was a precursor to the American Revolutionary War.

events.title: Italy Proclaimed a Kingdom
events.description: Victor Emmanuel II of Sardinia was declared the first King of a united Italy, marking the unification of much of the Italian peninsula.
events.significance: A major milestone in the Risorgimento, the unification of Italy, shaping modern European history.

events.title: First Irish National Flag Unfurled
events.description: The Irish tricolor flag was flown for the first time as a symbol of Irish nationalism and independence.
events.significance: Became the national flag of Ireland and a symbol of national identity.

events.title: Establishment of the First Republic of Ireland
events.description: Ireland was officially declared a republic, formally severing remaining ties with the British Commonwealth.
events.significance: Confirmed Irelandâ€™s full sovereignty and independence on an international scale.

events.title: Bosnian War Begins
events.description: The war in Bosnia and Herzegovina began following the country's declaration of independence from Yugoslavia.
events.significance: A tragic conflict marked by ethnic tensions, leading to widespread humanitarian crises and reshaping the Balkans.
